elements.title: French SS Volunteer Assault Brigade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that recruitment for the French SS Volunteer Assault Brigade (members pictured) was promoted through a Waffen-SS exhibition in Paris that attracted thousands of visitors daily?

elements.title: No Toilet, No Bride (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "No Toilet, No Bride" campaign encouraged women's families to demand a toilet as a precondition for marriage?

elements.title: her podcast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that GK Barry said that her girlfriend is used to Barry discussing their sex life on her podcast?

elements.title: Priyo Iswanto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Priyo Iswanto used what he called "WhatsApp diplomacy" to initiate diplomatic relations between Barbados and Indonesia?

elements.title: a South Carolina TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a South Carolina TV station began broadcasting just in time to ring in the New Year?

elements.title: Walang Biruan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kaia's Charice felt that she might run out of breath while recording the whisper-like chorus of "Walang Biruan"?

elements.title: Riley Walz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the data feed for a website created by Riley Walz tracking San Francisco parking enforcement officers in real time was shut down by city officials just four hours after the site's launch?

elements.title: O Bêbado e a Equilibrista (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "O Bêbado e a Equilibrista" was written as a samba to honor Charlie Chaplin, and became a political anthem for the return of exiles during the military dictatorship in Brazil?

elements.title: Madeleine Tchicaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Madeleine Tchicaya declined the president of Ivory Coast's offer to run for a second term in the National Assembly, as she was reportedly "bored to death"?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
